title: Bonhams Auctioneers Logo Font ID
content:
Hello All, I imagine this logo has been adjusted a little, but if anyone has an idea about what font it could be based on I really appreciate your advise.

Cheers,  
George

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Bonhams\_logo.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20140831072321/http:/typophile.com/files/Bonhams_logo.jpg) | 22.43 KB |
author: gfmcclure

comments.content: Thanks to this [more complete specimen](http://web.archive.org/web/20140831072321/http:/myfonts-wtf.s3.amazonaws.com/5e/5e08e9bc27f131374c4b595334ba384b.26914.png), I would probably start from [Frutiger Next](http://web.archive.org/web/20140831072321/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/frutiger-next) (to get such a /&), squoosh it and remove some vertical stems (pretty ugly work if you want my opinion).

Phoenica has similar forms. a little pushing and pulling could get you there.

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/preusstype/phoenica/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140831072321/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/preusstype/phoenica/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/preusstype/phoenica/")

and there's always this old thread:  
 [http://typophile.com/node/46453](http://web.archive.org/web/20140831072321/http:/typophile.com/node/46453 "http://typophile.com/node/46453")
